alert.note: Alert for Lauderdale; Limestone (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 24 at 11:29PM CDT until March 24 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN LIMESTONE AND NORTHEASTERN LAUDERDALE COUNTIES... At 1128 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 12 miles northeast of Rogersville, or near Anderson, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Elkmont, Lester, Good Springs, Cartwright, Cairo, Mt Rozell and Leggtown. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
